**Conjure Ball Lightning** is a level 6 [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")/[Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") spell which brings into existence 3 temporary instances of [ball lightning](/Ball_lightning "Ball lightning").

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 Monster Version](#Monster_Version)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 References](#References)

## Useful Info

Creates 3 ball lightning monsters - each one will individually home in on any existing, [visible](/Invisible "Invisible") creature, exploding when in range. They will also explode if destroyed. If no hostile monsters are in sight, ball lightings generally disperse away from the player.

Each ball lightning deals `3d(5 * pow/24 - 2.5)` electricity damage (min. 3d6),[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) in a 2 or 3 tile radius (same chance). As BEAM\_ELEC damage, the explosions ignore 1/2 of the target's [AC](/AC "AC").

Like [Foxfire](/Foxfire "Foxfire") and player-created [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud"), ball lightnings dissipate when out of the player's [LOS](/LOS "LOS"). However, the explosions themselves can hit monsters outside LOS.

## Strategy

Conjure Ball Lightning is an AOE spell that is strong in open areas. However, there's always the risk of the explosions hitting you.

[Electricity resistance](/Electricity_resistance "Electricity resistance") is highly recommended unless you want [YASD](/YASD "YASD"). If you lack a reliable source of rElec ([potions of resistance](/Potions_of_resistance "Potions of resistance") will work in a pinch, but not for general, repeated use), strongly consider choosing a different spell. Even with resistance, you can take upwards of 30 damage on a high roll.

If you decide to use CBL anyways, cast it only in where there is no other alternative and use these precautions: your target should be at the furthest possible range, with no nearby enemies (or plants); the enemy should ideally not be able to [blink](/Blink "Blink"), [summon](/Summon "Summon"), or use ranged attacks or spells (any of which might prematurely set off the ball lightnings); the player should move backwards right after casting, to get out of range; should the target be destroyed, the player should remain at a safe distance until all ball lightnings have detonated.

### Tips & Tricks

- Ball lightning only has 1-2 HP, so you can intentionally detonate one with virtually any non-elemental attack. [Stones](/Stone "Stone") and [Magic Darts](/Magic_Dart "Magic Dart") work well.
- Ball lightnings cannot see invisible. Casting the spell against an invisible enemy will simply cause your summons to wander aimlessly and ineffectively. If your target is, or has turned, invisible, you can always fire a projectile at a ball lightning to trigger detonation.
- Only [very few, specific creatures](/Category:Electricity_resistance "Category:Electricity resistance") have electricity resistance, making this a great all-around spell for area attacks on large numbers of creatures.

## Monster Version

The monster version functions similarly to the player version, though monster-created ball lightnings do not dissipate when out of the monster's LOS.

The following enemies cast Conjure Ball Lightning:

- & [![Lom Lobon.png](/images/f/f6/Lom_Lobon.png)](/File:Lom_Lobon.png) **[Lom Lobon](/Lom_Lobon "Lom Lobon")** (3 x 3d25 damage)

The following enemies may be able to cast Conjure Ball Lightning, depending on their spell set:

- & [![Pandemonium lord.png](/images/c/c6/Pandemonium_lord.png)](/File:Pandemonium_lord.png) **[Pandemonium lord](/Pandemonium_lord "Pandemonium lord")** (3.4% chance)

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), ball lightnings would home onto you if there were no valid targets.
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), the spell could conjure 2-5 instances of ball lightning, formula `1 + pow / 100 + 1d(pow / 50 + 1)` (max. 5, rounded down), but damage was always 3d20. Also, random [pandemonium lords](/Pandemonium_lord "Pandemonium lord") couldn't cast this spell.
- In [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), ball lightning AI was changed to work like [Foxfire](/Foxfire "Foxfire"). Previously, ball lightnings would home onto targets it didn't see, so it was easier to hit things from outside [LOS](/LOS "LOS"). It could also home onto [plants](/Plant "Plant") and other harmless "enemies".
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), CBL was a level 7 spell, and all ball lightnings were permanently [confused](/Confused "Confused").
- Prior to [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), ball lightnings had no duration after which they would explode.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [mon-explode.cc:77](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/mon-explode.cc#L77) (0.30.0)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [spl-summoning.cc:803](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/spl-summoning.cc#L803) (0.30.0)
